00017 #include "stdio.h"

00025 #define  INIT             1
00026 #define  TRAIN            2
00027 #define  EVALUATE         3
00028 #define  RESULT           4
00029 #define  PAUSE            5
00030 
00031 
00032 #define  TOLERANCE        0.e-10
00033 
00034 #define  LWPR1            1
00035 
00036 /* global variables */
00037 double  **Xw_train;      /* the input training data for the weights*/
00038 double  **Xreg_train;    /* the input training data for the regression*/
00039 double  **Xreg_train_2nd;/* the input training data for the regression*/
00040 double  **Xw_test;       /* the input test data for the weights */
00041 double  **Xreg_test;     /* the input test data for the regression*/
00042 double  **Xreg_test_2nd; /* the input test data for the regression*/
00043 double  **Y_train;       /* the output data */
00044 double  **Y_train_2nd;   /* the output data */
00045 double  **Y_test;        /* the test output data */
00046 double  **Y_test_2nd;    /* the test output data */
00047 double   *x_w;           /* the input for the weighting kernel */
00048 double   *x_reg;         /* the input for the regression */
00049 double   *x_reg_2nd;     /* the input for the regression */
00050 double   *y;             /* the predicted outputs for each center */
00051 double   *y_2nd;         /* the predicted outputs for each center */
00052 double   *conf;          /* confidence intervals */
00053 double   *conf_2nd;      /* confidence intervals */
00054 double   *var_y;         /* variance of the outputs for normalizaton */
00055 double   *var_y_2nd;     /* variance of the outputs for normalizaton */
00056 double   *mean_y;        /* variance of the outputs for normalizaton */
00057 double   *mean_y_2nd;    /* variance of the outputs for normalizaton */
00058 char      fname_train_data[100];
00059 char      fname_test_data[100];
00060 
00061 
00062 /* import the variables from main */
00063 extern    int   argc_global;
00064 extern   char **argv_global;
00065

00068 
00069 int      action = INIT;
00070 long     n_iterations;
00071 long     max_iterations;
00072 int      current_test_point;
00073 int      index_function;
00074 long     eval_time;
00075 int      sampling_method;
00076

00078 /* general variables */
00079 int      n_in_w = 0;
00080 int      n_in_reg = 0;
00081 int      n_in_reg_2nd = 0;
00082 int      n_out;
00083 int      n_out_2nd;
00084 int      n_train_data;
00085 int      n_test_data;
00086 int      blending = TRUE;
00087 double   cutoff = 0.001;
00088 char     lwpr_name[100];
00089 int      new_model = FALSE;

00093 double   nMSE_without;
00094 double   last_nMSE;

00098 double   nMSE_without_2nd;

00100 double   MSE_2nd;

00111 /*!*****************************************************************************
00112  *******************************************************************************
00113  \note  runLWPR
00114  \date  January, 1994
00115  
00116  \remarks 
00117  
00118  runs the lwpr simulator in an event loop
00119  
00120  *******************************************************************************
00121  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00122  
00123  none
00124  
00125  ******************************************************************************/
00126 void 
00127 runLWPR()
00128 
00129 {
00130     
00131   int    i,j,k,n;
00132   static int    rfIDlookup=0,rfIDadd=0;
00133   FILE  *out;
00134   char   string[100];
00135   static FILE *out1=NULL;
00136   double activation;
00137   double tt[100];
00138   double aux;
00139   static int *ar=NULL;
00140   double mean_n_out_pca, mean_n_in_reg, mean_var_vel;
00141   static int last_test_point = 0;
00142 
00143     
00144   switch (action) {
00145         
00146   case INIT:
00147                 
00148     initialize();
00149     action = TRAIN;
00150                 
00151     break;
00152                 
00153                 
00154   case TRAIN:
00155 
00156     /* draw a new training data point */
00157     draw_data_point(Xw_train,Y_train,n_train_data,
00158                     n_in_w,n_out,sampling_method,index_function,&ar,
00159                     x_w,y,&current_test_point);
00160 
00161     for (i=1; i<=n_in_reg; ++i)
00162       x_reg[i] = Xreg_train[current_test_point][i];
00163 
00164     if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00165       for (i=1; i<=n_in_reg_2nd; ++i)
00166         x_reg_2nd[i] = Xreg_train_2nd[current_test_point][i];
00167       for (i=1; i<=n_out_2nd; ++i)
00168         y_2nd[i] = Y_train_2nd[current_test_point][i];
00169     }
00170 
00171     /* nearest neighbor training is only useful for sequential sampling,
00172        and needs to fixed when data sets repeats itself */
00173     if (current_test_point != last_test_point+1)
00174       rfIDadd = 0;
00175 
00176     addDataToLWPR(LWPR1, x_w, x_reg, y,FALSE,&rfIDadd);
00177 
00178     if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00179       addDataToLWPRReg2nd(LWPR1,x_w,x_reg_2nd,y_2nd,1.0,FALSE,&rfIDadd);
00180     }    
00181 
00182     if (++n_iterations%eval_time == 0) {
00183       action = EVALUATE;
00184     }
00185 
00186     if (n_iterations > max_iterations) {
00187       action = EVALUATE;
00188     }
00189 
00190     break;
00191 
00192 
00193   case EVALUATE:
00194 
00195 
00196     /* run throught the X-test data and generate a nMSE */
00197 
00198     last_nMSE = nMSE;
00199     nMSE = MSE = 0;
00200     nMSE_without = MSE_without = 0;
00201     n_without = 0.;
00202     
00203     for (i=1; i<=n_test_data; ++i) {
00204 
00205       for (j=1; j<=n_in_w; ++j) {
00206         x_w[j] = Xw_test[i][j];
00207       }
00208 
00209       for (j=1; j<=n_in_reg; ++j) {
00210         x_reg[j] = Xreg_test[i][j];
00211       }
00212 
00213       if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00214         for (j=1; j<=n_in_reg_2nd; ++j) {
00215           x_reg_2nd[j] = Xreg_test_2nd[i][j];
00216         }
00217       }    
00218 
00219       rfIDlookup = 0;
00220       activation = 
00221         predictLWPROutput(LWPR1, x_w, x_reg, cutoff, blending, y, &rfIDlookup);
00222       if (activation < cutoff)
00223         activation = 0.0;
00224 
00225       for (j=1; j<=n_out; ++j) {
00226          nMSE += sqr(Y_test[i][j] - y[j])/var_y[j];
00227          nMSE_without += activation * sqr(Y_test[i][j] - y[j]) / var_y[j];
00228          MSE += sqr(Y_test[i][j] - y[j]);
00229          MSE_without += activation * sqr(Y_test[i][j] - y[j]);
00230          n_without += activation;
00231       }
00232 
00233       if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00234         predictLWPROutput2nd(LWPR1, x_w, x_reg_2nd, cutoff, blending, y_2nd, 
00235                              &rfIDlookup);
00236         for (j=1; j<=n_out_2nd; ++j) {
00237           nMSE_2nd += sqr(Y_test_2nd[i][j] - y_2nd[j])/var_y_2nd[j];
00238           nMSE_without_2nd += activation * sqr(Y_test_2nd[i][j] - y_2nd[j]) / var_y_2nd[j];
00239           MSE_2nd += sqr(Y_test_2nd[i][j] - y_2nd[j]);
00240           MSE_without_2nd += activation * sqr(Y_test_2nd[i][j] - y_2nd[j]);
00241         }
00242 
00243       }    
00244 
00245 
00246 
00247     }
00248 
00249     nMSE /= (double) (n_test_data*n_out);
00250     MSE /= (double) (n_test_data*n_out);
00251     if (n_without > 0) {
00252       nMSE_without /= (double) (n_without);
00253       MSE_without /= (double) (n_without);
00254     }
00255 
00256     if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00257       nMSE_2nd /= (double) (n_test_data*n_out);
00258       MSE_2nd /= (double) (n_test_data*n_out);
00259       if (n_without > 0) {
00260         nMSE_without_2nd /= (double) (n_without);
00261         MSE_without_2nd /= (double) (n_without);
00262       }
00263     }
00264 
00265     printf("%s: iter=%7ld:    nMSE = % 8.6f (% 8.6f)      MSE = % 8.6f (% 8.6f)\n                 #rf=%ld  #tr=%ld  #proj=%f  #pre=%ld  #pro=%ld\n",
00266            lwpr_name,
00267            lwprs[LWPR1].n_data,
00268            nMSE,
00269            nMSE_without,
00270            MSE,
00271            MSE_without,
00272            lwprs[LWPR1].n_rf,
00273            lwprs[LWPR1].n_no_trust,
00274            lwprs[LWPR1].mean_n_proj,
00275            lwprs[LWPR1].n_pruned_error,
00276            lwprs[LWPR1].n_pruned_overlap); 
00277 
00278     if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00279       printf("             nMSE_2nd = % 8.6f (% 8.6f)  MSE_2nd = % 8.6f (% 8.6f)\n                                #proj=%f\n",
00280              nMSE_2nd,
00281              nMSE_without_2nd,
00282              MSE_2nd,
00283              MSE_without_2nd,
00284              lwprs[LWPR1].mean_n_proj_2nd);
00285     }
00286       
00287     if (out1 == NULL) {
00288       sprintf(string,"%s.trace",lwpr_name);
00289       if (new_model)
00290         out1 = fopen(string,"w");
00291       else 
00292         out1 = fopen(string,"a+");
00293     }
00294 
00295     fprintf(out1,"%ld %f %f %f %f %ld %f ",
00296             lwprs[LWPR1].n_data,
00297             nMSE,
00298             nMSE_without,
00299             MSE,
00300             MSE_without,
00301             lwprs[LWPR1].n_rf,
00302             lwprs[LWPR1].mean_n_proj);
00303 
00304     if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00305       fprintf(out1,"%f %f %f %f %f",
00306               nMSE_2nd,
00307               nMSE_without_2nd,
00308               MSE_2nd,
00309               MSE_without_2nd,
00310               lwprs[LWPR1].mean_n_proj_2nd);
00311     }
00312 
00313     fprintf(out1,"\n");
00314 
00315     fflush(out1);
00316 
00317     if (fabs(last_nMSE-nMSE) < TOLERANCE || n_iterations >= max_iterations) {
00318       action = RESULT;
00319     } else {
00320       action = TRAIN;
00321     }
00322                 
00323     break;
00324                 
00325                 
00326   case RESULT:
00327                 
00328     /* dump the LWPR */
00329 
00330     writeLWPR(LWPR1);
00331 
00332     /* evaluate the test set */
00333 
00334     sprintf(string,"%s.res",lwpr_name);
00335     out = fopen(string,"w");
00336     if (out == NULL) {
00337       printf("Could not open result file -- exiting!\n");
00338       exit(-1);
00339     }
00340 
00341     for (i=1; i<=n_test_data; ++i) {
00342 
00343       for (j=1; j<=n_in_w; ++j) {
00344         x_w[j] = Xw_test[i][j];
00345         fprintf(out,"%f ",x_w[j]);
00346       }
00347       
00348       for (j=1; j<=n_in_reg; ++j) {
00349         x_reg[j] = Xreg_test[i][j];
00350         fprintf(out,"%f ",x_reg[j]);
00351       }
00352       
00353       if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00354         for (j=1; j<=n_in_reg_2nd; ++j) {
00355           x_reg_2nd[j] = Xreg_test_2nd[i][j];
00356           fprintf(out,"%f ",x_reg_2nd[j]);
00357         }
00358       }
00359 
00360       rfIDlookup = 0;
00361       predictLWPROutputConf(LWPR1, x_w, x_reg, cutoff, blending, y, &rfIDlookup, conf);
00362 
00363       for (j=1; j<=n_out; ++j) {
00364         fprintf(out,"%f %f ",y[j],conf[j]);
00365       }
00366 
00367       if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00368         rfIDlookup = 0;
00369         predictLWPROutputConf2nd(LWPR1, x_w, x_reg_2nd, cutoff, blending, y_2nd, &rfIDlookup, 
00370                                  conf_2nd);
00371         
00372         for (j=1; j<=n_out_2nd; ++j) {
00373           fprintf(out,"%f %f ",y_2nd[j],conf_2nd[j]);
00374         }
00375 
00376       }
00377 
00378       fprintf(out,"\n");
00379 
00380     }
00381 
00382     fclose(out);
00383 
00384     action = PAUSE;
00385                 
00386     break;
00387                 
00388                 
00389   case PAUSE:
00390 
00391     deleteLWPR(LWPR1);
00392     beep(1);
00393     exit(-1);
00394                 
00395     break;
00396                 
00397                 
00398   default:
00399                 
00400     break;
00401   }
00402     
00403     
00404 }
00405 
00406 /*!*****************************************************************************
00407  *******************************************************************************
00408  \note  read_script
00409  \date  January, 1994
00410  
00411  \remarks 
00412  
00413  reads in the script file which determines the task of this program
00414  
00415  *******************************************************************************
00416  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00417  
00418  Returns the number of data points
00419  
00420  ******************************************************************************/
00421 #define NORMALIZE_BY_TRAIN TRUE
00422 void
00423 read_script(void)
00424      
00425 { 
00426   
00427   int     i,j,k,m,rc;
00428   char    fname[100];
00429   double  dummy;
00430   int     idummy;
00431   FILE   *in,*out;
00432   int     n_train_data_columns;
00433   int     n_test_data_columns;
00434   Vector  row;
00435   char    identification_string[100];
00436   char    string[100];
00437   int     num;
00438   char    vnames[50][100];
00439   int     ans = 0;
00440   double  o_noise, c_noise;
00441   int     old_indx_flag = FALSE;
00442 
00443   Matrix  D_train=NULL;
00444   char  **vnames_train=NULL;
00445   char  **units_train=NULL;
00446   double  freq_train;
00447   int     n_cols_train;
00448   int     n_rows_train;
00449   
00450   Matrix  D_test=NULL;
00451   char  **vnames_test=NULL;
00452   char  **units_test=NULL;
00453   double  freq_test;
00454   int     n_cols_test;
00455   int     n_rows_test;
00456   
00457 
00458   /* I need the filename of the script file: first check whether the
00459      user provided it in the argv_global variables */
00460 
00461   if (argc_global > 0) {
00462     in = fopen(argv_global[1],"r");
00463     if (in != NULL) {
00464       fclose(in);
00465       strcpy(fname,argv_global[1]);
00466     } else {
00467       if (!getFile(fname)) exit(-1);
00468     }
00469   } else {
00470     if (!getFile(fname)) exit(-1);
00471   }
00472 
00473   /* this allows to generate the LWPR */
00474   if (argc_global > 1) {
00475     sscanf(argv_global[2],"%d",&new_model);
00476   } else {
00477     get_int("Generate new LWPR = 1; Read from file = 0",ans,&ans);
00478     if (ans) new_model = TRUE;
00479   }
00480 
00481   if (!readLWPRScript(fname,new_model,LWPR1)) {
00482 
00483     fprintf(stderr,"Error when reading script file >%s<\n",fname);
00484     exit(-1);
00485 
00486   }
00487   
00488 
00489   /* now read additional variables from the script */
00490   in  = fopen_strip(fname);
00491 
00492   /* check for included files */
00493   if (find_keyword(in,"include")) {  
00494     char  fname_include[100];
00495     FILE *fp_include;
00496 
00497     rc=fscanf(in,"%s",fname_include);
00498     fp_include = fopen_strip(fname_include);
00499     fseek(fp_include, 0, SEEK_END);
00500     rewind(in);
00501     while ((rc=fgetc(in)) != EOF)
00502       fputc(rc,fp_include);
00503 
00504     fclose(in);
00505     in = fp_include;
00506 
00507     rewind(in);
00508   }
00509     
00510   /* All the names in file will be parsed. Here I define the names of the
00511      variables. Note that the variables defining the dimensionality of
00512      the LWPR must come first since we need them to allocate other 
00513      variables */
00514 
00515   i=0; 
00516 
00517   /* this block has all variables needed to create a LWPR */
00518 
00519   sprintf(vnames[++i],"n_in_w");
00520   sprintf(vnames[++i],"n_in_reg");
00521   sprintf(vnames[++i],"n_out");
00522   sprintf(vnames[++i],"lwpr_name");
00523   sprintf(vnames[++i],"n_in_reg_2nd");
00524   sprintf(vnames[++i],"n_out_2nd");
00525 
00526   /* this block specifies all variables needed to get the data
00527      for training and testing, as well as some other parameters */
00528 
00529   sprintf(vnames[++i],"sampling_method");
00530   sprintf(vnames[++i],"index_function");
00531   sprintf(vnames[++i],"max_iterations");
00532   sprintf(vnames[++i],"eval_time");
00533   sprintf(vnames[++i],"cutoff");
00534   sprintf(vnames[++i],"blending");
00535 
00536   sprintf(vnames[++i],"file_name_train_data");
00537   sprintf(vnames[++i],"file_name_test_data");
00538 
00539   sprintf(vnames[++i],"name_train_in_w_columns");
00540   sprintf(vnames[++i],"name_train_in_reg_columns");
00541   sprintf(vnames[++i],"name_train_out_columns");
00542   sprintf(vnames[++i],"name_test_in_w_columns");
00543   sprintf(vnames[++i],"name_test_in_reg_columns");
00544   sprintf(vnames[++i],"name_test_out_columns");
00545   sprintf(vnames[++i],"name_train_in_reg_2nd_columns");
00546   sprintf(vnames[++i],"name_train_out_2nd_columns");
00547   sprintf(vnames[++i],"name_test_in_reg_2nd_columns");
00548   sprintf(vnames[++i],"name_test_out_2nd_columns");
00549 
00550 
00551   out = fopen("lwpr_test_varnames","w");
00552   for (j=1; j<=i; ++j) 
00553     fprintf(out,"%s\n",vnames[j]);
00554   fclose(out);
00555   remove_temp_file();
00556 
00557   /* parse keywords */
00558   i = 0;
00559 
00560   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00561     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00562     exit(-i);
00563   }
00564   rc=fscanf(in,"%d",&n_in_w);
00565 
00566   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00567     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00568     exit(-i);
00569   }
00570   rc=fscanf(in,"%d",&n_in_reg);
00571 
00572   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00573     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00574     exit(-i);
00575   }
00576   rc=fscanf(in,"%d",&n_out);
00577 
00578   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00579     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00580     exit(-i);
00581   }
00582   rc=fscanf(in,"%s",lwpr_name);
00583 
00584   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00585       if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00586         printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00587         exit(-i);
00588       }
00589   } else {
00590     rc=fscanf(in,"%d",&n_in_reg_2nd);
00591   }
00592     
00593   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00594     if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00595       printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00596       exit(-i);
00597     }
00598   } else {
00599     rc=fscanf(in,"%d",&n_out_2nd);
00600   }
00601 
00602   /* at last the parameters need to steer the training and testing of
00603      the LWPR */
00604   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00605     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00606     exit(-i);
00607   }
00608   rc=fscanf(in,"%d",&sampling_method);
00609 
00610   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00611     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00612     exit(-i);
00613   }
00614   rc=fscanf(in,"%d",&index_function);
00615 
00616   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00617     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00618     exit(-i);
00619   }
00620   rc=fscanf(in,"%ld",&max_iterations);
00621 
00622   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00623     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00624     exit(-i);
00625   }
00626   rc=fscanf(in,"%ld",&eval_time);
00627 
00628   if (find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00629     rc=fscanf(in,"%lf",&cutoff);
00630   }
00631 
00632   if (find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00633     rc=fscanf(in,"%d",&blending);
00634   }
00635 
00636   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i]) && argc_global <= 2) {
00637     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00638     exit(-i);
00639   }
00640   if (argc_global > 2) {
00641     strcpy(fname_train_data,argv_global[3]);
00642   } else {
00643     rc=fscanf(in,"%s",fname_train_data);
00644   }
00645 
00646   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i]) && argc_global <= 3) {
00647     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00648     exit(-i);
00649   }
00650   if (argc_global > 3) {
00651     strcpy(fname_test_data,argv_global[4]);
00652   } else {
00653     rc=fscanf(in,"%s",fname_test_data);
00654   }
00655 
00656 
00657   // at this point the data files can be read -- they are expected to be in
00658   // MRDPLOT format
00659 
00660   printf("Reading training data from >%s<...",fname_train_data);
00661   if (!mrdplot_convert(fname_train_data, &D_train, &vnames_train, &units_train, 
00662                        &freq_train, &n_cols_train, &n_rows_train)) {
00663     printf("Problems reading MRDPLOT file >%s<\n",fname_train_data);
00664     exit(-999);
00665   }
00666   printf("done\n");
00667   printf("%d rows with %d columns read\n",n_rows_train,n_cols_train);
00668 
00669   printf("Reading test data from >%s<...",fname_test_data);
00670   if (!mrdplot_convert(fname_test_data, &D_test, &vnames_test, &units_test, 
00671                        &freq_test, &n_cols_test, &n_rows_test)) {
00672     printf("Problems reading MRDPLOT file >%s<\n",fname_test_data);
00673     exit(-999);
00674   }
00675   printf("done\n");
00676   printf("%d rows with %d columns read\n",n_rows_test,n_cols_test);
00677 
00678 
00679   // allocate memory for all arrays
00680   Xw_train       = my_matrix(1,n_rows_train,1,n_in_w);      
00681   Xreg_train     = my_matrix(1,n_rows_train,1,n_in_reg);
00682   Xreg_train_2nd = my_matrix(1,n_rows_train,1,n_in_reg_2nd);
00683   Xw_test        = my_matrix(1,n_rows_test,1,n_in_w);
00684   Xreg_test      = my_matrix(1,n_rows_test,1,n_in_reg);
00685   Xreg_test_2nd  = my_matrix(1,n_rows_test,1,n_in_reg_2nd);
00686   Y_train        = my_matrix(1,n_rows_train,1,n_out);
00687   Y_train_2nd    = my_matrix(1,n_rows_train,1,n_out_2nd);
00688   Y_test         = my_matrix(1,n_rows_test,1,n_out);
00689   Y_test_2nd     = my_matrix(1,n_rows_test,1,n_out_2nd);
00690   x_w            = my_vector(1,n_in_w);
00691   x_reg          = my_vector(1,n_in_reg);
00692   x_reg_2nd      = my_vector(1,n_in_reg_2nd);
00693   y              = my_vector(1,n_out);
00694   y_2nd          = my_vector(1,n_out_2nd);
00695   conf           = my_vector(1,n_out);
00696   conf_2nd       = my_vector(1,n_out_2nd);
00697   var_y          = my_vector(1,n_out);
00698   var_y_2nd      = my_vector(1,n_out_2nd);
00699   mean_y         = my_vector(1,n_out);
00700   mean_y_2nd     = my_vector(1,n_out_2nd);
00701 
00702   // sort the test and training data into the appropriate arrays
00703 
00704   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00705     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00706     exit(-i);
00707   }
00708   for (j=1; j<=n_in_w; ++j) {
00709     rc=fscanf(in,"%s",string);
00710     if (!(k=findIndex(string,vnames_train,n_cols_train))) {
00711       printf("Couldn't find column >%s< in training data\n",string);
00712       exit(-i);
00713     } else {
00714       for (m=1; m<=n_rows_train; ++m)
00715         Xw_train[m][j] = D_train[m][k];
00716     }
00717   }
00718 
00719   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00720     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00721     exit(-i);
00722   }
00723   for (j=1; j<=n_in_reg; ++j) {
00724     rc=fscanf(in,"%s",string);
00725     if (!(k=findIndex(string,vnames_train,n_cols_train))) {
00726       printf("Couldn't find column >%s< in training data\n",string);
00727       exit(-i);
00728     } else {
00729       for (m=1; m<=n_rows_train; ++m)
00730         Xreg_train[m][j] = D_train[m][k];
00731     }
00732   }
00733   
00734   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00735     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00736     exit(-i);
00737   }
00738   for (j=1; j<=n_out; ++j) {
00739     rc=fscanf(in,"%s",string);
00740     if (!(k=findIndex(string,vnames_train,n_cols_train))) {
00741       printf("Couldn't find column >%s< in training data\n",string);
00742       exit(-i);
00743     } else {
00744       for (m=1; m<=n_rows_train; ++m)
00745         Y_train[m][j] = D_train[m][k];
00746     }
00747   }
00748   
00749 
00750   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00751     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00752     exit(-i);
00753   }
00754   for (j=1; j<=n_in_w; ++j) {
00755     rc=fscanf(in,"%s",string);
00756     if (!(k=findIndex(string,vnames_test,n_cols_test))) {
00757       printf("Couldn't find column >%s< in test data\n",string);
00758       exit(-i);
00759     } else {
00760       for (m=1; m<=n_rows_test; ++m)
00761         Xw_test[m][j] = D_test[m][k];
00762     }
00763   }
00764 
00765   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00766     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00767     exit(-i);
00768   }
00769   for (j=1; j<=n_in_reg; ++j) {
00770     rc=fscanf(in,"%s",string);
00771     if (!(k=findIndex(string,vnames_test,n_cols_test))) {
00772       printf("Couldn't find column >%s< in test data\n",string);
00773       exit(-i);
00774     } else {
00775       for (m=1; m<=n_rows_test; ++m)
00776         Xreg_test[m][j] = D_test[m][k];
00777     }
00778   }
00779   
00780   if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00781     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00782     exit(-i);
00783   }
00784   for (j=1; j<=n_out; ++j) {
00785     rc=fscanf(in,"%s",string);
00786     if (!(k=findIndex(string,vnames_test,n_cols_test))) {
00787       printf("Couldn't find column >%s< in test data\n",string);
00788       exit(-i);
00789     } else {
00790       for (m=1; m<=n_rows_test; ++m)
00791         Y_test[m][j] = D_test[m][k];
00792     }
00793   }
00794   
00795 
00796   if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00797 
00798     if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00799     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00800     exit(-i);
00801   }
00802     for (j=1; j<=n_in_reg_2nd; ++j) {
00803       rc=fscanf(in,"%s",string);
00804       if (!(k=findIndex(string,vnames_train,n_cols_train))) {
00805         printf("Couldn't find column >%s< in training data\n",string);
00806         exit(-i);
00807       } else {
00808         for (m=1; m<=n_rows_train; ++m)
00809           Xreg_train_2nd[m][j] = D_train[m][k];
00810       }
00811     }
00812     
00813     if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00814     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00815     exit(-i);
00816   }
00817     for (j=1; j<=n_out_2nd; ++j) {
00818       rc=fscanf(in,"%s",string);
00819       if (!(k=findIndex(string,vnames_train,n_cols_train))) {
00820         printf("Couldn't find column >%s< in training data\n",string);
00821         exit(-i);
00822       } else {
00823         for (m=1; m<=n_rows_train; ++m)
00824           Y_train_2nd[m][j] = D_train[m][k];
00825       }
00826     }
00827     
00828     if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00829     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00830     exit(-i);
00831   }
00832     for (j=1; j<=n_in_reg_2nd; ++j) {
00833       rc=fscanf(in,"%s",string);
00834       if (!(k=findIndex(string,vnames_test,n_cols_test))) {
00835         printf("Couldn't find column >%s< in test data\n",string);
00836       exit(-i);
00837       } else {
00838         for (m=1; m<=n_rows_test; ++m)
00839           Xreg_test_2nd[m][j] = D_test[m][k];
00840       }
00841     }
00842     
00843     if (!find_keyword(in,vnames[++i])) {
00844     printf("Could not find variable >%s<\n",vnames[i]);
00845     exit(-i);
00846   }
00847     for (j=1; j<=n_out_2nd; ++j) {
00848       rc=fscanf(in,"%s",string);
00849       if (!(k=findIndex(string,vnames_test,n_cols_test))) {
00850         printf("Couldn't find column >%s< in test data\n",string);
00851         exit(-i);
00852       } else {
00853         for (m=1; m<=n_rows_test; ++m)
00854           Y_test_2nd[m][j] = D_test[m][k];
00855       }
00856     }
00857 
00858   }
00859 
00860   fclose(in);
00861 
00862   n_train_data = n_rows_train;
00863   n_test_data  = n_rows_test;
00864 
00865 
00866   if (NORMALIZE_BY_TRAIN) {
00867 
00868     for (i=1; i<=n_train_data; ++i) {
00869       vec_add_size(mean_y,Y_train[i],n_out,mean_y);
00870     }
00871     vec_mult_scalar(mean_y,1./(double)n_train_data,mean_y);
00872 
00873     for (i=1; i<=n_train_data; ++i) {
00874       for (j=1; j<=n_out; ++j) {
00875         var_y[j] += sqr(Y_train[i][j]-mean_y[j]);
00876       }
00877     }
00878     vec_mult_scalar(var_y,1./(double)n_train_data,var_y);
00879 
00880     if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00881 
00882       for (i=1; i<=n_train_data; ++i) {
00883         vec_add_size(mean_y_2nd,Y_train_2nd[i],n_out,mean_y_2nd);
00884       }
00885       vec_mult_scalar(mean_y_2nd,1./(double)n_train_data,mean_y_2nd);
00886       
00887       for (i=1; i<=n_train_data; ++i) {
00888         for (j=1; j<=n_out_2nd; ++j) {
00889           var_y_2nd[j] += sqr(Y_train_2nd[i][j]-mean_y_2nd[j]);
00890         }
00891       }
00892       vec_mult_scalar(var_y_2nd,1./(double)n_train_data,var_y_2nd);
00893 
00894     }
00895 
00896   } else {
00897 
00898     for (i=1; i<=n_test_data; ++i) {
00899       vec_add_size(mean_y,Y_test[i],n_out,mean_y);
00900     }
00901     vec_mult_scalar(mean_y,1./(double)n_test_data,mean_y);
00902 
00903     for (i=1; i<=n_test_data; ++i) {
00904       for (j=1; j<=n_out; ++j) {
00905         var_y[j] += sqr(Y_test[i][j]-mean_y[j]);
00906       }
00907     }
00908     vec_mult_scalar(var_y,1./(double)n_test_data,var_y);
00909 
00910     if (lwprs[LWPR1].use_reg_2nd) {
00911 
00912       for (i=1; i<=n_test_data; ++i) {
00913         vec_add_size(mean_y_2nd,Y_test_2nd[i],n_out,mean_y_2nd);
00914       }
00915       vec_mult_scalar(mean_y_2nd,1./(double)n_test_data,mean_y_2nd);
00916       
00917       for (i=1; i<=n_train_data; ++i) {
00918         for (j=1; j<=n_out_2nd; ++j) {
00919           var_y_2nd[j] += sqr(Y_test_2nd[i][j]-mean_y_2nd[j]);
00920         }
00921       }
00922       vec_mult_scalar(var_y_2nd,1./(double)n_train_data,var_y_2nd);
00923 
00924     }
00925   }
00926 
00927   
00928 }

00931 /*!*****************************************************************************
00932  *******************************************************************************
00933  \note  initialize
00934  \date  January, 1994
00935  
00936  \remarks 
00937  
00938  initializes all necessary things
00939  
00940  *******************************************************************************
00941  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00942  
00943  none
00944  
00945  
00946  ******************************************************************************/
00947 void
00948 initialize(void)
00949      
00950 {
00951   
00952   int i,rc,ans=0;
00953   
00954   /* read script file */
00955   
00956   rc=system("/bin/rm -f *.rf"); /* added -f,    1/30/00, Jorg Conradt */
00957                                 /* so it doesn't complain about missing 
00958                                  *.rf files */
00959   read_script();
00960   
00961   /* some general variable defaults */
00962   
00963   last_nMSE = 1.e+10;
00964   n_iterations    = 0;
00965   current_test_point = 0; 
00966 
00967 }
00968 
00969 /*!*****************************************************************************
00970  *******************************************************************************
00971  \note  findIndex
00972  \date  April 2006
00973  
00974  \remarks 
00975  
00976  Find the index of a string in an array of strings
00977  
00978  *******************************************************************************
00979  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00980  
00981  \param[in]     name      : string to found
00982  \param[in]     vnames    : array of strings
00983  \param[in]     num       : how many elements in vnames
00984 
00985  returns either a postive index, or FALSE if failure
00986  
00987  
00988  ******************************************************************************/
00989 static int
00990 findIndex(char *name, char **vnames, int num)
00991      
00992 {
00993   
00994   int i;
00995 
00996   for (i=1; i<=num; ++i) {
00997     if (strcmp(name,vnames[i])==0 && strlen(name)==strlen(vnames[i]))
00998       return i;
00999   }
01000 
01001   return FALSE;
01002 }
